items.sentence: The coach named Tom the captain of the team.

Tom just can\'t seem to get along with Mary.

All Tom really needed was about ten dollars.
Tom says that he\'s never tasted whale meat.
Tom does know what he\'s doing, doesn\'t he?
Tom isn\'t watching a basketball game on TV.
This restaurant has many vegetarian options.
Tom and Mary were disgusted with each other.
It\'s likely that Tom will do that tomorrow.
It\'s not likely that Tom did it on purpose.
My friends and I seldom talk about politics.
Tom told me that he isn\'t going to do that.
Why on earth didn\'t you take your medicine?
I\'ll buy you another one if you want me to.
I\'ll call you up around eight this evening.
I\'ll come visit you at your house tomorrow.
I couldn\'t believe that that was happening.
I couldn\'t get my idea across to the class.
I couldn\'t go with you even if I wanted to.
Tom certainly isn\'t very good with numbers.

Don\'t worry. I\'ll take care of it for you.

Tom tells me you might want to stay with us.

I wanted to let you know you weren\'t alone.

Tom didn\'t think Mary would really do that.
I don\'t think we have enough paint thinner.

Let\'s discuss these problems one at a time.

Tom doesn\'t seem to be having any problems.
I\'ll have to tell Tom the truth eventually.

I had not expected Tom to be at the meeting.
I wish Tom wouldn\'t always talk about work.
I appreciate everything you\'ve done for me.
